sentences.en: America was mired in stagflation, with an unemployment rate nearing double digits.
Inflation, unemployment, on both i . e . stagflation, are manifestations of business cycles.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀, 失业或者二者并存, 即滞胀是商业周期的表现.

sentences.en: Many of the industrialized economies would be pushed into a cycle of stagflation.
sentences.cn: 许多工业化经济将被推入到一个滞胀的循环中。

sentences.en: Operation, control positions in order to tap the main varieties of stagflation.
sentences.cn: 操作上, 控制好仓位,以挖掘滞涨品种为主.

sentences.en: Stagflation can be a harbinger of economic depression.
sentences.cn: 景气不好、通货膨胀可能是经济衰退的预兆.

sentences.en: Stagflation is a very unpopular buzz word in the business world.
sentences.cn: 滞胀是商界不受欢迎的时髦词语.

sentences.en: Stagflation is portmanteau word made of stagnation and inflation.
sentences.cn: 滞涨是由停滞和通货膨胀两个词所组成的合成词.

sentences.en: Stagflation is the combination of high unemployment and economic stagnation with inflation.
sentences.cn: 滞胀是相结合的高失业率和经济停滞与通货膨胀.

sentences.en: Worst cases can lead to recession or the dreaded'stagflation ", when inflation soars and growth sputters.
sentences.cn: 当时最严重的情况是在通货膨胀物价剧增时导致经济萧条或可怕的滞涨现象.

trans.tran_cn: 不景气状况下的物价上涨，滞胀
trans.tran_en: If an economy is suffering from stagflation, inflation is high but there is no increase in the demand for goods or in the number of people who have jobs
